meta.title: 100 Most Common Words
meta.description: The 100 most common words in English, which make up half of all written material.

about: Only 100 words make up half of all written material. Let's learn them!

cards.explanation: an indefinite article used to indicate a noun or noun phrase
cards.hint: the apple

cards.explanation: relating to or concerning something
cards.hint: This movie is about a group of friends who travel the world.

cards.explanation: completely, entire
cards.hint: I have all the necessary materials.

cards.explanation: in addition to something else; also
cards.hint: I like coffee and tea.

cards.explanation: a conjunction used to connect fronts, phrases, or clauses in a sentence
cards.hint: I like and hate coffee.

cards.explanation: in the same manner, degree or amount as something else.
cards.hint: He plays soccer as well as basketball.

cards.explanation: in a location or position; on something
cards.hint: She put her book at the top of the shelf.

cards.explanation: to exist or have a quality
cards.hint: She is a good singer.

cards.explanation: reason or cause for something
cards.hint: I'm going to the movies because I want to see a new movie.

cards.explanation: used to indicate a contrast or exception, often used to introduce a negative statement.
cards.hint: I wanted to go, but I had other plans.

cards.explanation: with the help of or using something as an instrument
cards.hint: The teacher used a ruler by her side to measure the length of the paper.

cards.explanation: capable of being used for a particular purpose
cards.hint: She can sing beautifully.

cards.explanation: to move towards someone or something
cards.hint: She will come to the party tonight.

cards.explanation: can or may be done
cards.hint: She could speak English fluently.

cards.explanation: a period of time between sunrise and sunset, especially as a unit of time used in calendars.
cards.hint: I love spending my days at the beach.

cards.explanation: to accomplish or perform something
cards.hint: She has to do her homework tonight.

cards.explanation: being equal in amount, degree, or value
cards.hint: She has an even smile.

cards.explanation: to discover or locate something
cards.hint: She will find the book on the shelf.

cards.explanation: initial or primary in order, time, or degree
cards.hint: The first day of school was a big success.

cards.explanation: used to indicate purpose or intention
cards.hint: I'm doing this for you

cards.explanation: originating from a place or person
cards.hint: I am from New York.

cards.explanation: to obtain or acquire something
cards.hint: I will get a coffee from the café.

cards.explanation: to provide or supply something to someone or something
cards.hint: Can you give me a cup of water?

cards.explanation: to move or travel from one place to another
cards.hint: I want to go to the store.

cards.explanation: to possess or hold something
cards.hint: I have a dog.

cards.explanation: a person considered as the subject of a sentence or clause, especially when referring to himself or herself
cards.hint: John is he.

cards.explanation: relating to or characteristic of a female person or animal; belonging to her; intended for or affecting only females
cards.hint: The dress was designed for her.

cards.explanation: Beloved or dear one
cards.hint: She is my aziza.

cards.explanation: the person or animal referred to by the pronoun he or she
cards.hint: He is a great friend of his.

cards.explanation: belonging to him
cards.hint: That's his car.

cards.explanation: in what way or manner
cards.hint: I want to know how you did it.

cards.explanation: to what end or purpose
cards.hint: I'm not sure why I feel this way.
This is a sentence with the front I.

cards.explanation: used to indicate a condition or circumstance
cards.hint: I will go if the weather permits.

cards.explanation: within or inside something; being contained within a surface
cards.hint: She looked in the mirror.

cards.explanation: in a place where something is or is put into
cards.hint: She put the book into the bag.

cards.explanation: an object, person, or thing
cards.hint: She is reading it.

cards.explanation: belonging to it or its possessive pronoun
cards.hint: The cat chases its tail.

cards.explanation: correct, fair, reasonable, appropriate
cards.hint: She felt that the punishment was just.

cards.explanation: to be aware of or to have knowledge of something
cards.hint: I know how to ride a bike.

cards.explanation: to have a preference for something
cards.hint: I like ice cream

cards.explanation: to see or glance at something
cards.hint: She took a look around the room.

cards.explanation: to produce or create something
cards.hint: She makes a great cup of coffee.

cards.explanation: an adult male human being
cards.hint: a tall man with a beard entered the restaurant

cards.explanation: a large or numerous quantity of something
cards.hint: I have many books on my shelf.

cards.explanation: belonging to or identified with the speaker or addressee of a sentence, question, or utterance
cards.hint: I'm going to the store for me and my friend.

cards.explanation: a greater amount or degree
cards.hint: I need more milk.

cards.explanation: belonging to me
cards.hint: That's my book.

cards.explanation: recently created or experienced; existing for the first time
cards.hint: I just got a new phone.

cards.explanation: used to indicate refusal or denial
cards.hint: I don't want to go.

cards.explanation: used for negation, opposite of something
cards.hint: I don't like ice cream.

cards.explanation: at this time, present moment
cards.hint: I will meet you now.

cards.explanation: used to indicate a relationship of involvement, possession, or origin.
cards.hint: She is the daughter of John.

cards.explanation: being on something, having a position or location
cards.hint: She placed the phone on the table.

cards.explanation: a single entity or unit of quantity, amount, etc.
cards.hint: I need one apple for the pie.

cards.explanation: sole or exclusive
cards.hint: She is the only one who can help.

cards.explanation: used to indicate a choice between two or more things, to show that something is true, or to indicate a possibility
cards.hint: Do you want coffee or tea?

cards.explanation: not one of the others; unlike
cards.hint: I want the other book.

cards.explanation: belonging to us, something shared or enjoyed by a group of people
cards.hint: We are going on vacation our week.

cards.explanation: moving from a place or situation to another
cards.hint: I'm going out for dinner.

cards.explanation: A group of human beings
cards.hint: The people in the park were playing games.

cards.explanation: to express or communicate something
cards.hint: She says she's happy.

cards.explanation: to perceive with the eyes or to understand
cards.hint: I can see the Eiffel Tower from here.

cards.explanation: the female subject of a sentence or the object of a verb
cards.hint: She is going to the store.

cards.explanation: used to indicate agreement or confirmation, especially when talking about something that is obvious or has already been mentioned.
cards.hint: That's so cool!

cards.explanation: a small amount or quantity
cards.hint: I ate some food for breakfast.

cards.explanation: to receive something given to you, or to move your hand towards something
cards.hint: Can I take my phone?

cards.explanation: to communicate or share information verbally
cards.hint: She told me about her new job.

cards.explanation: used for comparison
cards.hint: He is taller than I am.

cards.explanation: used to introduce a person or thing
cards.hint: I like that book.

cards.explanation: a definite article used to refer to a specific person, place, or thing
cards.hint: I want the book on the table.

cards.explanation: belonging to them, used as possessive pronoun after a singular or plural noun
cards.hint: Their car is red.

cards.explanation: people or things regarded as the subject of a sentence
cards.hint: They are going to the store.

cards.explanation: in that case, next
cards.hint: I'll meet you then.

cards.explanation: indicating a place or direction
cards.hint: Put the book over there on the table.

cards.explanation: used to refer to things previously mentioned or easily identified
cards.hint: I'm going to these movies with you.

cards.explanation: used to refer to people or animals, especially as a group of three or more
cards.hint: She is going to meet them at the store.

cards.explanation: a person, place, or thing of interest or importance
cards.hint: The new smartphone is a great thing.

cards.explanation: to consider or reflect on something carefully and wisely
cards.hint: She takes a moment to think before making a decision.

cards.explanation: Used to refer to something or someone near the speaker, a specific time or event, etc.
cards.hint: Can you pass me this book?

cards.explanation: used to refer to a group of people or things that are already known or mentioned
cards.hint: I want to go to those places I visited last year.

cards.explanation: the measure of the duration between events or periods
cards.hint: I have a meeting at 2 o'clock.

cards.explanation: in the direction of or destination
cards.hint: She's going to the store.

cards.explanation: a numerical value indicating the quantity of 2
cards.hint: I have two apples.

cards.explanation: in a direction vertically upwards or to an upper position
cards.hint: She walked up the stairs.

cards.explanation: to employ or utilize something for a particular purpose
cards.hint: She will use the computer to finish her project.

cards.explanation: to a great degree or extent
cards.hint: She is very happy.

cards.explanation: to have a desire or wish for something
cards.hint: I want to go to the beach.

cards.explanation: a path or route
cards.hint: She chose her way through the forest.

cards.explanation: plural form of 'us'
cards.hint: They are with us.

cards.explanation: in a good or satisfactory manner
cards.hint: a source of fresh water

cards.explanation: used to ask for information or explanation about something
cards.hint: I want to know what's going on.

cards.explanation: at what time
cards.hint: I will meet you when the bus arrives.

cards.explanation: used to ask for hints or specify which one
cards.hint: Which book did you read?

cards.explanation: a person or people
cards.hint: Who is going to the party?

cards.explanation: future tense of 'can' or 'shall'
cards.hint: I will go to the movies tonight.

cards.explanation: accompanied by
cards.hint: She is with her friends.

cards.explanation: past tense of will or could, used to express possibility or necessity
cards.hint: I would have gone if I had known about it.

cards.explanation: A period of time that has passed or is about to pass, typically measured in years.
cards.hint: I will celebrate my birthday next year.

cards.explanation: the person or people being addressed or referred to
cards.hint: How are you doing today?

cards.explanation: belonging to you, indicating possession or belonging
cards.hint: That is your book.
